main event: Two orange lights were observed in the sky over Nashville, Tennessee on September 21, 1967. One of the lights was moving westward.
interesting points: The objects remained stationary for over an hour before suddenly darting away at a high rate of speed, indicating they were under intelligent control.
The witness described the objects as large and bright, with an estimated size of about 200 feet in diameter.
There were 3 other witnesses who also observed the objects.
The witness stated the objects' speed and maneuvers were far beyond the capabilities of any known aircraft.
The witness compared the brightness of the objects to a bright star or flashlight.
sighted object: two orange lights in the sky
